snippet: Representative Steve Scalise of Louisiana will go anywhere, and talk to anyone, his friends say, and that in part may be what led him to address a group of white supremacists.
abstract: Rep Steve Scalise's friends and allies say 2002 speech he gave to group of white supremacists associated with former Ku Klux Klan grand wizard David Duke in Metairie, La, stems from his willingness to speak to anyone; while a review of Scalise's political history does not suggest he is a racist, his claimed ignorance of group's views is suspect and his speech to group seem like example of his political ambition.
lead_paragraph: Representative Steve Scalise of Louisiana will go anywhere, and talk to anyone, his friends say, and that in part may be what led him to address a group of white supremacists.

headline.main: Allies Say Willingness to Talk to Anyone, Nearly His Undoing, Defines Scalise
headline.print_headline: Allies Say Willingness to Talk to Anyone, Nearly His Undoing, Defines Scalise
